id: U.S. Adopts New Battle Plan to Fight  China’s Theft of Trade Secrets
paragraph: November 17, 2018The Trump administration is broadening its China trade battle beyond tariffs with a plan to use export controls, indictments and other tools to counter the theft of intellectual property, according to people familiar with the matter.The opening move in the new strategy came in the form of a recent crackdown by the Commerce and Justice Departments on a Chinese state-owned chip maker, which the U.S. administration accused of stealing trade secrets from Idaho-based Micron Technology Inc., the people said.WSJ MembershipCustomer ServiceTools & FeaturesAdsMore
